alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 1:05PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River At Clifton affecting Wayne, Perry, Hardin and Decatur Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Clifton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River At Clifton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 368.0 feet, In Perry County, water reaches the low lying portions of access roads in the Peters Landing area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 364.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Action stage is 364.0 feet. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 715 AM CST.
